scripts.say: The Royal Islands
Looks like the Sardegna Fleet has begun to move.
Warspite, did something happen?
Oh, you're here, Illustrious. Come take a look at this photo taken by our reconnaissance planes and tell me what you see.
I can see... Cavour, Cesare, and the Zara sisters... And where was this photo taken?
Above La Spezia harbour.
The one located in the hinterlands, yes? I'm sure they're there to rest and resupply after their battle with the Sirens.
But, why would the Sirens be in the Mediterranean in the first place...?

I can think of several reasons. While this may be nothing more than the usual poking and prodding from the Sirens, we cannot discount the possibility that this was a test run for a much larger invasion to come.

Regardless, Sardegna's behaviour is concerning to me. The way they mobilised so many capital ships to suppress such a paltry foe in an almost theatrical show of force contradicts their long-held naval doctrine.
Are you saying it was a demonstration of their strength?
Hmm... It's hard to say...
Perhaps we should bring this to the discussion table before acting. They might have an explanation that we aren't seeing.
It's not too late for them to rejoin Azur Lane, and if they were to do so, the matter would resolve by itself.
You're right. I'll inform Her Majesty.
So we negotiate first, but still plan for the next phase... A well thought out strategy, so I'll allow it!
Warspite, you do understand the point of this operation, yes? Never forget the pride of the Royal Navy. Put them in their place!
Yes, Your Majesty!
However, if possible, I would like to avoid a repeat of the Vichya incident. That embarrassing event affected our standing within the Azur Lane...
"A wise general understands how to win a war. A wise ruler understands how to avoid a war."
Belfast casually poured tea for the Queen as she recited her quote.
I was ordered by Her Majesty to deliver these words to you, Warspite, were you to bring up the Vichya incident.
Very well... I have faith in Her Majesty's judgement. I shall depart immediately!
Warspite bowed to Queen Elizabeth, then exited the throne room.
"Look after Her Majesty for me," she says?
I certainly hope it doesn't come to that...
